subject: Music
title: Music and the Anti-Apartheid Movement
description: One-minute skill: Music and the Anti-Apartheid Movement.

hook.text: Music helped end apartheid in South Africa â€” making the world care about injustice it couldn't see.

buildup.text: South African artists like Miriam Makeba sang about oppression to international audiences.

discovery.text: The 1985 Sun City album organized artists to boycott apartheid South Africa.

twist.text: Free Nelson Mandela by the Special AKA became a global anthem heard in 30 countries.

climax.text: When Mandela was freed, he thanked musicians for keeping pressure on the regime.

punchline.text: Musicians couldn't open the prison. But they made the world demand it.

quiz.question: How did music contribute to ending apartheid?
options: It raised global awareness and pressured the regime through boycotts
